pyphoon¶

pyphoon is a python library developed since 2018 by interns at Kitamoto Lab to provide simple, easy and a pythonic interaction with the Digital Typhoon dataset. It contains a wide set of tools to assist in the exploration of the data and detection of possible corrupted files. You can find the GitHub repository here.

Get Familiar: Set up the required environment and test some of the code provided examples.

  • Setting up the environment
  • Code examples

Available Projects: List of projects developed using pyphoon.

  • Tropical Cyclone vs. Extra-Tropical Cyclone classifier

Documentation¶

For further details on any of the modules of this library check the corresponding link below.

  • pyphoon.io
    • pyphoon.io.h5
    • pyphoon.io.tsv
  • pyphoon.clean
  • pyphoon.utils
    • pyphoon.utils.eda_jma

Known Issues¶

  • Importing the library

    As of now, to correctly import the library, please make use of sys.path specifying the directory of the library. In the future, however, we plan on pushing this library to PyPI repository.

    >>> import sys
>>> sys.path.insert(0, 'path/to/pyphoon')

  • Using matplotlib in the server Trying to generate plots in the server without graphical interface can lead to an error when trying to import the library matplotlib. To avoid this, make sure to use a non-interactive backend such as agg.

    >>> import matplotlib
>>> matplotlib.use('agg')
